info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Jackson, northwestern Greenville, Pickens and northeastern Oconee Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles north of Easley to 10 miles west of Pickens to 18 miles north of Walhalla. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pickens, Easley, Six Mile, Salem, Lake Keowee, Jocassee Gorges, Lake Jocassee, Devils Fork State Park, Keowee Toxaway State Park and Table Rock State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
